Judul: MODELING OF ACID MINE DRAINAGE TREATMENT DEVELOPMENT FOR MINE CLOSURE (CASE STUDY: ON2 AREA, LATI MINE OPERATION, BERAU COAL)
Abstrak:
Coal is one of the primary energy commodities in Indonesia. With the development of coal mining activities, the
environmental impacts caused will be more numerous and widespread. One of the environmental impacis of
mining activities is the emergence of acid mine drainage and mining pit lakes, which, if not appropriately
managed, will pose a danger to the surrounding community. This research aims to develop an integrated model
of acid mine drainage for the mine closure area, 10 predict output water which complies with. Modeling results
show the applicability of passive treatment On ihe mine pit lake outlet to enhance the water guality. This option
offers an increase in pH from 3.00 to 6.21 by mixing 504,000 m' of Northern ON2 pit lake water with 323,000 m3
of Southern ON2 and East ON2 pit lake water which has been repaired and rainwater with a volume of 16,000
m3. On the other hand, there was a significant decrease in Fe and Mn concentrations. The modeling result Shows
ihat Fe and Mn concentrations dropped by 7726 and 5996 in a single rainfall event. The alternative is deemed
sufficient to produce expected efflueni water that meets regulatory water guality standards from the coal mine.
